text: <!here> anyone getting 502 errors in their HubSpot sites?
<@U38EZFVFE> We have a status page up to follow this here: <https://status.HubSpot.com/incidents/5b24sm6b2yf4?utm_source=slack>

Hey there. Problem with Google Analytics HubSpot Integration
When I click on “Enable your Google Analytics integration by checking the box and adding your tracking code” the code is well put on my HubSpot Page but when I disable the checkbox the code is still appearing... Is someone already see this issue ?
DONE : for your information, if you check this box on Default for All Domains and uncheck you also have to uncheck on every domain
Anyone run into issues getting third party analytics to load on AMP pages? I’m seeing that there’s an amp-specific GTM container, but it seems that HubSpot doesn’t support it currently.
Has anyone ever built a template with a "load more" on a blog listing page instead of pagination?
<@U2H1Q3F8R> You could use something like <http://jscroll.com/> to do that

So I know this was sent in an email to some, but I feel like this should be shared here for all the devs to give input on as well. If anyone from HS wants me to remove this link, let me know:
<https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/FLGPZ8S>
The only drawback to an auto-load like this is if there is something i want to see in the footer, i then have to keep constantly scrolling until I hit the end of the posts.
Exactly <@U2H3TT8F2> you’re right ! I that case my customer has many posts so he prefers having scrolling than navigation. It’s a choice :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U2H3TT8F2> and <@U3TR96G84> or you just put a button that appears like the go to top arrows that exists -- except go to bottom
i'd just do something like awwwards does
not sure why they do it (unless they are testing)  but a load more would def be best option
